block.p: I enjoyed John Sutherland's review of ''Quarrel & Quandary'' (Oct. 8), Cynthia Ozick's book of essays, except for a sentence reporting her educational background. Sutherland states, ''She was lucky enough to attend New York's P.S. 71 at a time when the city's high schools were educational powerhouses for the upwardly mobile.''
P.S. 71 is an elementary school, not a high school. Ozick attended Hunter College High School, one of the city's most prestigious schools.
